alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:27PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs and central Fremont Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Anchor Dam, or 18 miles north of Pavillion, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Hot Springs and central Fremont Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Wind River Basin
